results.title: Floating rice
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Thanom Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
The simple way of life of the people in the central plains of Thailand and their method of cultivating rice is shown through the wet and dry season.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Thanom Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Terra nova
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Fernand Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Among these lively impressions of Newfoundland today, coloured by history and by the sea, there are scenes of historic events, fishing on the high seas and squid jigging inshore, mining deep underground, and operations of the giant pulp and paper industry. (Award: Los Angeles.)

results.title: Children of Bangkok
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Thanan Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
The film follows three Bangkok boys, from different economic classes through a typical day. One boy is the son of an Army colonel in the upper middle class, the second, the son of a middle-class shopkeeper and the third, the son of a lower class migrant farm worker. The film shows a cross section of life in Bangkok.

results.title: Terminal velocity
results.creator_credit: Deran Sarafian, Tom Engelman, Scott Kroopf, Buena Vista and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: All is not what it seems in this action thriller starring Charlie Sheen as the hard-playing reckless skydiving teacher, Ditch Brodie, who finds himself asking questions when his beautiful new student Chris Morrow (Nastassja Kinski) mysteriously meets with a tragic accident on her first jump. Suspense and intrigue follow as Brodie accused of manslaughter is caught up in international espionage involving the Russian mafia. Cast includes James Gandolfini, Chris McDonald.

results.title: Teresa
results.creator_credit: Gerard Vergez and Francois de Lannurien
results.brief_description:
Teresa, a middle aged women in financial strife has to take in a tenant. A young woman soon moves in. Lorenzo, Teresa’s estranged lover soon becomes infatuated by the young tenant. Awards: Grand Prix Feminin du Cinema, 1970.

Credits: Producer, Francois de Lannurien ; director, Gerard Vergez ; writers, Gerard Vergez, Michel Arnaud ; photography, Guy Fellous ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Suzanne Flon, Robert Rimbaud, Anne Doat, Jeanne Allard.

results.title: Chiang Mai: northern capital
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Thanom Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
In Chiang Mai, Thailand’s northern capital, many traditions and crafts have remained unchanged for hundreds of years. This film looks at the native handicrafts, including the production of silver jewellery, lacquerware utensils and silk-weaving. We take part in a colourful festival which marks the end of the Buddhist Lent. Through the day and into the night we see the solemn religious ceremonies, and the carefree carnival, complete with fireworks

results.title: Tenosinovitis
results.creator_credit: Women's Film Unit and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Female sufferers of tenosynovitis describe how they became injured. They discuss the way that their injuries have affected their lives within the workforce and at home, where often they must perform all the domestic duties.
results.description: Female sufferers of tenosynovitis describe how they became injured. They discuss the way that their injuries have affected their lives within the workforce and at home, where often they must perform all the domestic duties.

results.title: Tennis: the greats
results.creator_credit: ABC Video, Jack Egan and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: From Suzanne Lenglen and Bill Tilden, the champions of the 1920s, to Margaret Court and Rod Laver at the end of the 1950s, this film shows the great players of the past in action. Film, privately owned by Adrian Quist, including travel with the Davis Cup teams enhances the story, which also discusses the inevitable rise of professional tennis. Narrated by Adrian Quist

results.title: Tennant Creek in passing
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film views Tennant Creek in the form of a passing glimpse, beginning with some long-shot filming of the natural environment and mines at sunrise in an approach to the town, focusing on buildings, inhabitants, passing vehicles and travellers, and completing the view with aerial shots moving away from Tennant Creek at sunset.

results.title: Tender mercies
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Robert Duvall, Horton Foote, Antron Media and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A compassionate love story tracing the relationship between a burnt-out country and western star and a young widow he meets in a Texas motel. His past is littered with the spoils of fame and scarred by alcoholism, two broken marriages and a painful descent from stardom so that he lacks confidence in relationships and has a low opinion of himself and others. The widow and her young son help him to rebuild his life and to appreciate the healing power of affection. Stars Robert Duvall and Tess Harper.
